001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.conversion;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.DeserializationContext;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.KeyDeserializer;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidFormatException;
007import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
008import org.bitcoinj.base.AddressParser;
009import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
010import org.bitcoinj.base.exceptions.AddressFormatException;
011
012import java.io.IOException;
013
014/**
015 * Key Deserializer to support using Address as the key in a Map.
016 */
017public class AddressKeyDeserializer extends KeyDeserializer {
018    private final AddressParser addressParser;
019
020    /**
021     * Construct an address deserializer that will deserialize addresses for the default supported networks.
022     * See {@link Network} to understand what the supported networks are.
023     */
024    public AddressKeyDeserializer() {
025        this(AddressParser.getDefault());
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * Construct an address KeyDeserializer with a custom {@link AddressParser}
030     * @param addressParser parser to convert a string to an address
031     */
032    public AddressKeyDeserializer(AddressParser addressParser) {
033        this.addressParser = addressParser;
034    }
035
036    /**
037     * Construct an address KeyDeserializer that validates addresses for the specified {@link Network}.
038     * When deserializing addresses, addresses that are not from the specified network will cause a
039     * {@link InvalidFormatException} to be thrown during deserialization.
040     *
041     * @param network specify the only network we will deserialize addresses for.
042     */
043    public AddressKeyDeserializer(Network network) {
044        this( (network != null)
045                ? AddressParser.getDefault(network)
046                : AddressParser.getDefault());
047    }
048
049    @Override
050    public Object deserializeKey(String key, DeserializationContext ctxt) throws IOException, JsonProcessingException {
051        try {
052            return addressParser.parseAddress(key);
053        } catch (AddressFormatException afe) {
054            throw new InvalidFormatException(ctxt.getParser(), "Invalid Address: " + key, key, Address.class);
055        }
056    }
057}
